page.title: 11ADULTS VIEWS OF CUCKFIELD
page.content: Most of the citizens interviewed lived in Cuckfield for at least 60 years. Most still liked living in Cuckfield but didn't think there was much future for Cuckfield the way Cuckfield was going with development and technology. Particular dates remembered were 1945, the end of the war, when all the children had street parties and everyone decorated the streets with flags and paper chains. Similar celebrations were remembered for the 1953 coronation. When they were young they played with hoops and tops. Most of the interviewed said that children were as well behaved now as they were 20 years ago. Some of the people said that the community spirit had disappeared but Mr. Palmer disagreed and said people had become more friendly.
